content.description: Sit start towards the opening of the cave, do two moves to the good rail and finish wrecking ball. Not sure about the grade as usual. Maybe slightly easier intro moves?
#18 Start on two low crimps inside the cave, traverse left on neat crimps to a large match around the corner. Then move straight up on crimps to the top.
content.location: North up the hill from Battlestar Galactica to the right of #14, #15, #16

content.description: #15 Start matched on the low shelf, follow the slopey shelves left too a big move near the lip, then top out.
content.location: Directly up the hill north of BattleStar Galactica. Left of Wrecking Ball.

content.description: Stand Start on crimps moving up the arete
content.location: Down and west from The Prow about 10 yards.

content.description: Name and grade from Bockino/Ward guide.  Chossy down low and dirty up high, but still good fun.  Start matched on a hollow, fragile jug on the steep face.  Top out on good jugs.
content.location: Continue up the main gulley from Battle Scar Galactica.

content.description: One of the prizes of the area.  Start matched in the undercling crimp with foot out on the enormous block of stone making your body horizontal. Enjoy this one and take lots of pics for instagrams.
content.location: Hiking west from Collective Mind about 30 Yards, you can't miss this iconic arete of the rock that looks out over the highway and river.

content.description: Sit start on jug move right on slopey crimps and find the path of least resistance to the jug. This problem is on the same boulder at the prow but on the left side of the boulder if facing it. Just past collective mind
Name and grade from Bockino/Ward guide.  Traverse the lip with heel hooks to reach a high hold just off the arete; rock over.
content.location: Up the main gully from Snap to Attention.

content.description: Start on a good slot, reach the slopey edge to the left under the roof and kick your foot over to a toehook on the big slopey edges also under the roof. After that climb backwards and climb into the obvious crack. Topout is optional. Very gym like climb and a rare encounter for outdoor bouldering!
content.protection: A couple pads if you choose to do the Dabby topout.
content.location: Right behind wrecking ball if your facing it.

content.description: Stand start on the obvious jug on the far right of the little corridor traverse left around the corner and up the face. Pumpy! I'm unsure of the actual name so please let me know if you want it changed. Downclimb the VB arete (be careful because a fall would be bad)
content.protection: Maybe a spotter for the crux over the small pit.

climbs.name: Collective Mind
climbs.fa: Probably JohnnyG or Demitri or something

content.description: Start on the massive jug going left.
content.location: Find "Battlestar", hike on the top of it heading west. Collective Mind will be below it in the narrow cave on the path

content.description: Name and grade from Bockino/Ward guide.  Start low on crimps, bump up to gastons and more crimps.
content.protection: Multiple pads for rocky, uneven landing.
content.location: Directly opposite the Battle Scar Galactica roof crack.

content.description: Led back in the 80's I believe and rediscovered and bouldered in 2008 (Bockino, Ruth, Dolence)
content.location: Walk up towards the climbs and this is the obvious slab with a 15 foot roof crack at the top.

content.description: start as for #15, move straight up on crimps to the top.
content.location: Directly up the hill north of BattleStar Galactica. Left of Wrecking Ball.

content.description:
Sit-start with matched hands on the diamond shaped hold on the farthest lefthand side of the overhanging face. Big left slap to the gritty arete and move your body around to the slab and up. Enjoy the epic view from the top. Here's a video for beta...

youtube.com/watch?v=fs9QBa7â€¦
content.location: Directly South of The Prow. The Enormous overhanging face has some bolts on it for some sport as well. Looks out over the river and highway facing west
